pull.title: refactor: VectorWriter and SpanReader without nVersion
pull.body: The serialize version is unused, so remove it. This also allows to remove `GCS_SER_VERSION` and allows a scripted-diff to remove most of `CDataStream`.

events.body:

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#28333](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28333) (wallet: Construct ScriptPubKeyMans with all data rather than loaded progressively by achow101)
* [#26728](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26728) (wallet: Have the wallet store the key for automatically generated descriptors by achow101)
* [#25907](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25907) (wallet: rpc to add automatically generated descriptors by achow101)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

verification.payload:
tree 796b195f7feba774f65c72916d8be501dda54b11
parent fac39b56b723f79ba0aa9570708a1d4a600f4e12
author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1700402280 +0100
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1701171757 +0100

scripted-diff: Use DataStream in most places

The remaining places are handled easier outside a scripted-diff.

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
 sed --regexp-extended -i 's/CDataStream ([0-9a-zA-Z_]+)\(SER_[A-Z]+, [A-Z_]+_VERSION\);/DataStream \1{};/g' $( git grep -l CDataStream)
 sed -i 's/, CDataStream/, DataStream/g' src/wallet/walletdb.cpp
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

events.message:
scripted-diff: Use DataStream in most places

The remaining places are handled easier outside a scripted-diff.

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
 sed --regexp-extended -i 's/CDataStream ([0-9a-zA-Z_]+)\(SER_[A-Z]+, [A-Z_]+_VERSION\);/DataStream \1{};/g' $( git grep -l CDataStream)
 sed -i 's/, CDataStream/, DataStream/g' src/wallet/walletdb.cpp
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

events.body: What are the places where CDataStream is still needed after this and what will happen to these?
Should end up removed completely in #28451.
